conclusion: Determine the ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity of basketball during collision with ground.
Basketball dropped from rest at height H above ground.
Gravitational force acting on basketball is mg.
Air resistance force is λmg, where λ is a constant.
Net force acting on basketball as it falls is mg(1 - λ).
Velocity just before collision with ground is v = √(2g(1 - λ)H).
Basketball rebounds to maximum height h above ground.
Net force acting on basketball as it rises is mg(1 + λ).
Ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity is √((1 + λ)h/(1 - λ)H).
Final answer: Ratio is √((1 + λ)h/(1 - λ)H).
